intro: Epicampes stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It typically grows in moist to wet soils in woodland or swampy areas. The plant features simple, alternate, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. The plant is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic and is a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family.
